授業目的: 本授業の目的は、英語教育における政策、カリキュラム、教授、そして教材の分析およびデザインについての知識を得るために、過去および現在の状況を踏まえつつ、学生が言語教育における文化の基本的な理解を深めることである。
到達目標: 本授業修了時点、学生は、次のことができることを目標とする。・様々な視点から文化とはどのようなものかを理解し、説明することができる・言語と文化の関係を理解し、説明することができる・英語と文化の関係を理解し、説明することができる・「グローバル・ランゲージ」の現状をふまえ、言語教授における文化の取り扱い方に関連したテーマおよび問題を説明理解し、説明することができる・言語教授の政策やカリキュラム、教材、そして教授を批判的に評価しデザインするために、自分自身の理解を応用することができる
授業の概要・背景:
This class examines concepts, practices, and issues related to culture in the learning and teaching of English and other foreign languages in today's globalized world. Content will be presented through a combination of lectures and readings and further elaborated through in-class discussion.

In Part 1 (Classes 1-5), we examine general questions related to culture and language and their relationship, as well as the major historical, typological, and contemporary features of the English language as it relates to culture and the people connected to it both past and present. A written assignment summarizing individual learning in Part 1 will be completed. 

Part 2 of the class (Classes 6-14) focuses on the treatment of culture in English and other second/foreign language teaching in the context of globalization and today’s interconnected world. Various paradigms and perspectives will be studied, followed by an examination of applicability to current issues of language teaching policy, curriculum, materials, and instructional practices in general and in Japan. Based on this, students will prepare and give a presentation (week 13) and submit a written summary of it as a final assignment which demonstrates individual learning through an application and extension of ideas and other content covered. This will take the form of: 
1) Design of a lesson and/or unit plan, 2) Introduction of a research article which clarifies its connection and application to ideas and other content covered in class, 3) Analysis/critique of educational materials, 4) Analysis/critique educational policy, 5) Combination of the preceding or other assignment discussed in advance with the instructor.
